intro: Oreopanax albanensis, commonly known as the Albanian mountain sarsaparilla, is a climbing plant native to the mountainous regions of Albania. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Oreopanax albanensis thrives in shaded, moist environments and is adapted to high-altitude conditions.
